|| Ordinal Label Encoding Technique ||



This technique is applicable on ordinal categorical data.


- Ordinal data is a categorical, statistical data type where the variables have natural, ordered categories and the distances between the categories is not known. - For example : - We have a feature education with values SSC,HSC,Diploma,Batchlor,Master,PhD so we can easily rank this : - PhD person is hold a rank 1 - Master = rank 2 - Batchlor = rank 3 - Diploma = rank 4 - HSC = rank 5 - SSC = rank 6. - We have a feature experience with different values in years formalt. Here we rank base on how much year of experience person have. person with : - 10+ yr exp = 1st rank, - 5 to 10 yr exp = 2nd rank - 0-5 ye exp = 3rd rank.
